posts.post_content:
If you're feeling like a real jerk, go for [Goblin Settler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Settler). Blow up a land every turn. While you're at it, throw a few [Goblin Grenade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Grenade)s in your deck.
  
   
The possibilities with this thing are endless, great card.
  
   
4.5/5

posts.post_content:
Imprint [Meddling Mage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Meddling Mage)! It turns Magic: The Gathering into Go Fish.
  
You: "Ummmmmmmmm... do you have any [Terminates](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terminates)?"
  
You: "Go fish. Do you have any... lightning bolts?"
  
Etc., and so on and so forth.
  
   
Or...
  
You: "I imprint... [Dryad Arbor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dryad Arbor)!"
  
Opponent: "NNNNNOOOOO!!!!!"
  
   
Or...
  
You: "I imprint... [Relentless Rats](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Relentless Rats)!"
  
Opponent: "Oh..."
  
You: "And play [Power Artifact](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Power Artifact) on it!"
  
Opponent: "I..."
  
You: "And [Doubling Season](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doubling Season)!!!"
  
Opponent: "..."
  
   
Or...
  
You: "I imprint... [Ornithopter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ornithopter)!"
  
Opponent: "Oh, great, a free blocker every turn. Wonderful. Your mother would be so proud."
  
You: "And [Doubling Season](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doubling Season)!"
  
Opponent: "Oh, sure, TWO free blockers every turn. Because you will defeat me with your mighty 0/2 flyers."
  
You: "And [Clock of Omens](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Clock of Omens)!"
  
Opponent: "...Oh. I see what you did there."

Opponent: "I..."

posts.post_content:
You know, a simple combo would be using a classic Rat card that causes an opponent to discard.
  
"Oh, you just drew your card,
  
In response, get rid of it."
  
The first discard that can work at instant speeds.

posts.post_content:
like [AEther Vial](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=AEther Vial), you can put your creatures into play with this without having to worry about any color problems.  
  
on top of this, there is an endless list of useful things you can do with imprinted creatures that provide you with cip effects or something similar every turn. a powerful weapon to create all kinds of interesting effects, like even soft-locks for example by using [Chittering Rats](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chittering Rats).

posts.post_content:
Am I the only one who sees it?  
  
Play this turn four with a [Chimney Imp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chimney Imp) imprint.  
On your opponent's upkeep, unless they lock your mana or constantly draw cards, they are locked and you have as many Chimney Imps as you want.

posts.post_content:
[Dryad Arbor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dryad Arbor) is the first idea that I had, then I thought about [Lotus Cobra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lotus Cobra) (drop a few [Primeval Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Primeval Titan) and hard cast [your win condition)](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=193452) Less-assured mana, but more constant/combo-y; also, you don't need to tap the cobras in order to benefit from the mana gain, so you could use them as chump blockers or extra attackers for an [Overrun](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Overrun).  
  
Alternatively, if you want to draw cards, imprint [Taunting Elf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Taunting Elf) and equip [Infiltration Lens](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Infiltration Lens) and watch the fun happen. Might help to have a [Spellbook](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spellbook) out though, lol.   
  
This card's ludicrous potential reminds me of [Isochron Scepter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Isochron Scepter)
posts.html:
Dryad Arbor is the first idea that I had, then I thought about Lotus Cobra (drop a few Primeval Titan and hard cast your win condition) Less-assured mana, but more constant/combo-y; also, you don't need to tap the cobras in order to benefit from the mana gain, so you could use them as chump blockers or extra attackers for an Overrun.

Alternatively, if you want to draw cards, imprint Taunting Elf and equip Infiltration Lens and watch the fun happen. Might help to have a Spellbook out though, lol.

This card's ludicrous potential reminds me of Isochron Scepter

posts.post_content:
This card is so much fun. The possibilities are endless.  
  
I used a deck where I imprint [ornithopter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=ornithopter) on this bad boy.  
I sacrifice the ornithopter for [megatog](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=megatog).  
Then [Dross Scorpion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dross Scorpion )  untaps soul foundry.  
Rinse and repeat over and over again for a scary huge megatog with trample.
